DOC.brief_summary: Our hypothesis is that intensive training with positive biofeedback may enhance postural control and stability in Parkinson's disease patients and in elderly fallers.
DOC.brief_title: Bio-Feedback to Improving Stability in Elderly Population
DOC.detailed_description: The aim of the study is to treat Parkinson's patients and elderly fallers. The intervention is intensive training with Biofeedback to try to correct stooped posture, and to improve stability in standing and in walking.
DOC.criteria: Idiopathic PD for >2 yrs Between 5090 Yrs On antiParkinsonian medication Hoehn & Yahr 23 in "ON" Free of serious comorbidities Able to walk but reports difficulties in gait Can use assistive device Significant orthopedic disturbances or pain Major depression (DSM IV) Dementia (MMSE<24) Clinically significant hearing problems Unstable medical condition (2 wks from meds change) Deep Brain Stimulation
